intro: Melanoseris polyclada, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically produces violet or purple flowers in terminal clusters, often with a distinctive yellow or white throat. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Melanoseris polyclada is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
